queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.spec.containers.name={{curl}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.
Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.spec.containers.name={{curl}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{config}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{config}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{step-certificates-init}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{step-certificates-init}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{step-certificates}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{step-certificates}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-config}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-config}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, create, update, patch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Name Undefined Or Empty
queries.description: A Kubernetes Pod should have a Service Account defined so to restrict Kubernetes API access, which means the attribute 'serviceAccountName' should be defined and not empty.

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles when binded, should not use get, list or watch as verbs

files.expected_value: The metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-config}}.rules.verbs should not contain the following verbs: [["get", "create", "update", "patch"]]

queries.description: Namespaces like 'default', 'kube-system' or 'kube-public' should not be used

'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

queries.query_name: Image Pull Policy Of The Container Is Not Set To Always
queries.description: Image Pull Policy of the container must be defined and set to Always

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{step-certificates}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache

queries.description: Image tag must be defined and not be empty or equal to latest.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{config}}.image tag is provided and not latest
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{config}}.image tag is not provided or latest

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{step-certificates-init}}.image tag is not provided or latest

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.spec.containers.name={{curl}}.image tag is provided and not latest
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.spec.containers.name={{curl}}.image tag is not provided or latest

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{step-certificates}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{step-certificates}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{step-certificates-init}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{step-certificates-init}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{config}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{config}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{curl}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{curl}}

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated

files.actual_value: spec.containers.name=curl does not have a security context
metadata.name={{release-name-step-certificates-test-connection}}.spec does not have a security context

queries.description: Check if the root container filesystem is not being mounted read-only.
